p: In the present study, we investigated the use of a novel ambient lighting intervention, Programmed Environmental Illumination (PEI) using freestanding light fixtures that delivered either Bright White Light (BWL) or Dim White Light (DWL) daily during hospitalization. The BWL delivered a CS ≥ 0.30 at the eye between 7 and 10 am daily during hospitalization. A similar lighting system delivering a CS ≥ 0.30 showed a significant improvement in sleep, mood, and behavior in our field research with Alzheimer's disease patients and other populations. 23, 29, 30, 31 Relative to other light delivery systems, such as light boxes or light goggles, PEI requires no patient effort; the patient is able to remain passive in bed as the circadian stimulating light illuminates the room.
